Package cards.action_cards.pay_player

Class Lawsuit

java.lang.Object
cards.Card
cards.ActionCard
cards.action_cards.PayThePlayer
cards.action_cards.pay_player.Lawsuit
All Implemented Interfaces:
MachineRandom
public class Lawsuit
extends PayThePlayer
Class implementing a Lawsuit action card, which asks the player to pay money to another player of his/her choice, equivalent to the litigation fee indicated in this card.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Lawsuit()
    Creates a Lawsuit action card object

  • Constructor Details

    • Lawsuit

      public Lawsuit()
      Creates a Lawsuit action card object

      In particular, a Lawsuit action card has its attributes initialized as follows:

      • Its name is "Lawsuit".
      • The lower bound for the litigation cost is $50000.
      • The upper bound for the litigation cost is $150000.
      • The increment for the litigation cost is $10000.

      The bounds and the increments were decided upon by the programmers.

      The constructor of the parent class takes care of the initialization of the litigation cost.

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute​(Player currPlayer, Player otherPlayer, Bank b)
      Executes the action specified in this card, that is, the player pays money to another player of his/her choice, equivalent to the litigation cost indicated in this card
      Parameters:
      currPlayer - current player with turn
      otherPlayer - player who will be paid by the current player with an amount equivalent to the litigation cost indicated in this card
      b - Bank of the game

    • getInfo

      public java.lang.String getInfo()
      Returns the card description to be displayed as a prompt during the actual gameplay

      In particular, the card description reads as follows: "You have lost a lawsuit. Pay [litigation cost] to a player of your choosing."

      Specified by:
      getInfo in class ActionCard
      Returns:
      card description to be displayed as a prompt during the actual gameplay

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this card, which includes its name and the amount it instructs the player to pay the player of his/her choice.

      In particular, the representation contains the following details:

      • Type of card (Action card)
      • Name of the card (Lawsuit)
      • The header "Amount Paid to Other Player" (which is a general description of the Pay the Player category of action cards)
      • The litigation cost as the amount paid to the other player
      Overrides:
      toString in class PayThePlayer
      Returns:
      string representation of this card
